listing.description:
Job description

Reading Plus is looking for front-end engineers to join our Product Development team. You will collaborate closely with all team members to build a functional and scalable architecture for web applications that serve millions of students and educators.

 

What you will do:

  • Connect front-end with back-end services
  • Monitor, test and continuously optimize your code
  • Deliver modern, testable and maintainable code
  • Collaborate with other engineers, product owners/managers, UX designers, and QA
  • Work in an environment that supports both, your team's advancement and your individual growth
  • Ensure that our customer’s experience is the very best it can be

 

Who you are:

  • Your personal values align with ours (knowledge, empathy, commitment & collaboration)
  • You are intimately familiar with agile development paradigms
  • You are adaptable, resourceful and able to develop effective solutions to problems
  • You have a proven background building user-friendly, data-rich progressive web applications
  • You are experienced with modern JavaScript coding, testing, debugging and automation techniques
  • You care about web technologies, exploring data, usability and design
  • You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, and are happy to communicate your ideas clearly
  • You have experience with continuous delivery and automated testing
  • You value team success over personal success

 

Technologies:

  • Polymer library (substitute React or Vue)
  • Web components (Custom Elements, Shadow DOM, HTML Imports & Templates)
  • Git (no substitute)
  • JavaScript (Async, Promises, Service Workers)
  • CSS (familiar with the latest W3C working group snapshot)

 

Bonus:

 

  • A degree in Computer Science or adjacent areas
listing.perks:
Happy to assist with relocation.
Dog-friendly office.
Much, much more...
listing.title: Front-End Engineer

company.tagline: We help students become successful readers & lifelong learners.
company.name: Reading Plus

listing.description:
At Logical Position, we’re on a mission to help businesses grow. With nearly 5,000 clients and 6 locations across the U.S., we’re one of the fastest growing digital marketing agencies in the country. And we love what we do! We’re rated highly on Glassdoor and ranked #3 Best Workplace in America by Inc. Magazine. Every day we hustle to deliver exceptional outcomes for our clients while enjoying the amazing company culture we’ve worked hard to build. From catered meals and company parties to free event passes and outdoor excursions, we create an environment where our team can thrive. If you’ve got the drive to succeed and a passion for growth, we’re looking for you!   

 

Department: Website Development 

Location: Deer Park, IL 

Pay: $45k/yr & up (DOE) 

Benefits: Health/Dental/Vision + 401(k) + Life + LTD Insurance 

Hours: Full-time, Monday - Friday 

 

The Job in a Nutshell: 

We are looking for a creative, talented and motivated individual who wants to continue a website design career. You will work as a part of our Website Development team taking WordPress sites from start to finish-- if you have a knack for modern design and experience creating or customizing pre-made WordPress themes and plugins, we would love to see your portfolio! Most work will be done using WordPress but occasionally clients may need work done on non-WordPress sites, so experience with additional content management systems is a plus.  

  

What You Will Love Doing: 

  • Creating custom websites from pre-made themes using WordPress and create hard-coded non-WordPress websites for clients as needed 
  • Helping develop a library of WordPress themes for quick use 
  • Installing code snippets and plugins on client websites 
  • Managing the development and implementation of client website designs from start to finish 
  • Coordinating with other departments to ensure client requirements and needs are met prior to launch 
  • Using advanced knowledge of code languages and content management systems 
  • Staying up to date with emerging technologies 
  • Identifying opportunities for new features and product offerings 

  

To Fit the Bill: 

  • Bachelor's Degree in a related field or applicable professional experience 
  • 2+ year(s) recent WordPress design experience, including the use of WooCommerce 
  • Experience manipulating and customizing pre-made WordPress themes 
  • Comfortable adding/troubleshooting various WordPress plugins 
  • Strong HTML, PHP, CSS3, and MySQL knowledge 
  • Ability to work with/create hard-coded non-WordPress sites  
  •  Experience building responsive sites  
  •  Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
  • Experience with Photoshop or other photo editors 
  • Have an online portfolio of demonstrated work 
  • All candidates must be eligible to work in the United States without visa sponsorship 

  

To Score Extra Points: 

  • Strong Adobe CS skills 
  • Experience with Gutenberg 
  • Understanding of Custom Post Types 
  • Experience with a CSS preprocessor, such as Sass or LESS 
  • Working knowledge of JavaScript/jQuery 
  • Strong knowledge of CMS’s other than WordPress 
  • Understanding of basic SEO principles 
  • Experience with REST APIs
listing.title: Website Developer - Wordpress

listing.description:
Interviewing for a new company is a serious time commitment for all parties involved. Please take the time to read this and thoughtfully consider if we would be a good fit for one another. This is a full-time position. You must be located in Texas and be able to interact in person with our team in McKinney, TX. No contractors or agencies. Seriously.

Why We Started PestRoutes

Several years ago, we were searching for the right software for managing a pest control office to connect our sales module that we built for sales team. We looked and looked for something that was cloud-based, mobile friendly, and actually would make the life of our customers easier. We were SHOCKED to find nothing that met our customer expectations.

We kept thinking to ourselves, "why doesn't someone make something that the customers would love?" Finally, we realized it was up to us. Since then we have dedicated our lives to creating the world's greatest software for managing pest control offices--and we have succeeded!

We’ve got lofty goals for rapid growth—we need you to continue to push the boundaries of what is possible using software to solve day-to-day challenges. You will not only be part of something great but will have opportunities to accelerate your career in ways not available to many people.

What You’ll Be Working On

You will be working on a platform that runs a field service company B2E. Your work will impact every part of the customer lifecycle including sales, marketing, scheduling, CRM, billing, mobile field service applications, communication (SMS, email, voice, snail mail, push notifications, etc...), credit card processing, reporting, customer portals, reviews, and more! We work with dozens of APIs and frameworks and are truly a platform on which our customers utilize as their primary and central tool.

PestRoutes is currently rebuilding our Mobile Applications. After our MVP is launched you’ll continue to implement new features, improve existing functionality, fixing bugs, and creating documentation for our internal team as well as our customers.

This Role: Mobile Applications Engineer

We collaborate with the customer success team and technical support to define the most needed areas of improvement. Your job will focus on implementing the features and functionality assigned to you from our CTO who will set the priorities in collaboration with these teams. These assignments range between bug fixes, new reports, an assortment of new features, and code improvements.

The platforms are diverse between mobile, desktop, customer-facing, and internal use. What you do here matters and will be used by thousands of people. It is therefore extremely important that code is not only tested and bug-free, but also maintains our standards of quality so that we can continue to be the best pest control software in the world. There will be a lot of complex and hairy problems we will ask you to solve under tight deadlines. We expect you to not only solve these problems but to solve them well.

How We Operate

You cannot build something great without a solid foundation. PestRoutes has been built upon a solid foundation of core values. We use these before we hire any team member and we recognize and promote our people based on how these values are demonstrated. This is where the true strength and power of our product comes from. Learn more about our values on PestRoutes.com.

Our standard workweek is Monday - Friday, and our office is open between the hours of 8:00 am and 5:00 pm or 9:00 am and 6:00 pm.

How You’ll Be Compensated

We believe in fair compensation, depending on your skill and experience, you can expect to make somewhere between $90,000 and $140,000 annually upon joining the company. We have an excellent health plan available to our employees, and we cover 100% of the cost of the premium of a Blue Cross Blue Shield Bronze PPO plan for our each of our employees. You can also elect to pay for an upgrade to the plan we offer and to cover dependents.

Additional Perks: Twice a month we will either all go out as a team to lunch or dinner or cater a meal into the office. This helps us all take a breath and build team unity. We also provide an assortment of free drinks and snacks in the office for your enjoyment.

Holidays / Paid Time Off - We offer 10 paid vacation days + the following holidays: Memorial Day, President’s Day, Labor Day, 4th of July, Christmas (3 days), New Years, Thanksgiving (2 days). PTO is accumulated and increases by two days per year, up to a max of 20 days PTO.

We also offer 5 sick days per calendar year to cover personal or immediate family health concerns.

This position is on-site.

Currently, the PestRoutes staff works full-time in McKinney, TX. When you start working at PestRoutes, you’ll pair with our development team rebuilding the mobile app, to learn the ropes of the product and code-base, third-party integrations, deployment, business decisions, etc.

 

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field
  • 3+ years expert level React Native
  • 3+ years expert level working with mobile apps that have offline capabilities
  • 1+ year with iOS native development. We use native code for few features integrated with React Native app
  • 1+ year with Android native development. We use native code for few features integrated with React Native app
  • 3+ Ability to implement complex and core features into a mature code base
  • Strong knowledge of mobile UI design principles, patterns, and best practices
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect to back-end service
  • Proven ability to track down, solve, and release solutions to bugs and issues
  • Experience with version control and deployment strategies
  • High attention to detail and ability to take responsibility for core changes
  • Passion for development and high desire to release code
  • Experience with Realm or SQLite databases

 

How To Apply

This is a full-time employment opportunity for a single individual. We’re not looking for contractors, part-time individuals, or agencies of any kind. Applicants must be located in Texas. Thanks!

To apply, please send us a note to jobs-pestroutes@verypossible.com with {{PestRoutes Mobile Engineer}} in the subject line. Please include the following:

  1. What’s most important to you from a company culture and operating environment?
  2. What are the biggest things that de-motivate you and make you unhappy when it comes to being an independent engineer within a company?
  3. Your resume
  4. Code samples with comments explaining what you did and how you architected the code.
listing.title: Mobile Applications Engineer

listing.description:
Our purpose:

Healthcare is confusing. It’s hard to access, to understand, and to ensure you’re getting the right care that leads to the right outcomes. Grand Rounds exists to make a difference in all of it. Our vision is to craft a path to great health and health care, for everyone, everywhere. We work alongside company’s insurance plans, helping to guide people to the best care for them.

 

Our team:

We’re a tight, collaborative team of product designers, marketing designers, and user experience researchers, working in close partnership with our product management and engineering teams. We are passionate advocates for all our users - from our award-winning Care Team, to our doctors and clinicians, to the members that use our products every day. We realize that we have the opportunity to transform a confusing and archaic system and we relish the challenge of making life better for the people that need us the most.

 

You!

We’re looking for a Product Designer craft a better future with us. Somebody who can envision and deliver delightful, insightful, and engaging experiences which will guide our Members to achieve better health outcomes. You’ll help us transform how people access, understand, and interact with their care.

You have crafted and delivered insightful experiences that brought clarity to complex situations. You possess an innate curiosity and a drive to understand people’s motivation and behavior. You think systemically and find joy in figuring out how all the pieces fit together. You love educating people on how to best uncover and address user needs through elegant and insightfully designed experiences.

Cross-functional peers across the organization come to you for advice on how to better understand the impact they’re delivering in marketing, sales, and product.  Your clear and inviting communication brings people along, and your empathy and connection help them effectively reach their users.

You build positive relationships with product managers, engineers, and front-line support. You value open and honest discussion and are always looking to learn. You wholeheartedly empathize with the human side of the patient experience and want to make healthcare delightful.

 

Requirements:

  • A body of work that clearly demonstrates insight, empathy, and an ability to tackle complex problems on behalf of users
  • Minimum 6 years of experience in design, with an emphasis on shipping useful, usable, and delightful products
  • Mastery of current design tools, responsive web design standards, and the current state-of-the-art for consumer-facing experiences
  • Passionate advocacy for high-quality design, execution, and implementation of interactive web sites and mobile apps.
  • Experience developing, testing, and refining concepts based on research, insights, and brand vision.
  • Comfort managing a project from inception through execution.
  • Able to see the broader picture while delighting in the quality and nuance of the specifics.
  • Compelling communication capabilities. You understand that sharing the insights is the most impactful part of what you do.  

 

Rounds is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law. Grand Rounds considers all qualified applicants in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
listing.title: Senior Product Designer

company.tagline: We are reimagining and transforming how people experience health care
company.name: Grand Rounds

listing.description:
About Us:

Grand Rounds' vision is to create a path to great health and health care, for everyone, everywhere. Founded in 2011, the company provides an employer-based technology solution that connects members and their families to high-quality care. With Grand Rounds, employers get a personalized, high-performance network at scale, while their employees get the tools and support needed to navigate their care on their own terms. Named Rock Health’s 2018 Fastest Growing Company, Grand Rounds helps restore individual health and quality of life, and offers employers lower health care spend and higher employee productivity. For more information, please visit  www.grandrounds.com.

 

Our Purpose:

Healthcare is confusing. It’s hard to access, to understand, and to ensure you’re getting the right care that leads to the right outcomes. Grand Rounds exists to make a difference in all of it. Our vision is to craft a path to great health and health care, for everyone, everywhere. We work alongside company’s insurance plans, helping to guide people to the best care for them.

 

Our team:

We’re a tight, collaborative team of product designers, marketing designers, and user experience researchers, working in close partnership with our product management and engineering teams. We are passionate advocates for all our users - from our award-winning Care Team, to our doctors and clinicians, to the members that use our products every day. We realize that we have the opportunity to transform a confusing and archaic system and we relish the challenge of making life better for the people that need us the most.

 

You!

We’re looking for a deeply curious Lead UX researcher who is intrigued by the uniqueness of each person, while being able to discern the patterns in group behaviors. If you strive to understand the underlying motivations of seemingly contradictory decision making, in order to help companies and individual help themselves, we might have a perfect role for you.

You’re excited to own an entire research portfolio and program end-to-end.  You know the kind of questions that can benefit from your experience and expertise, and you’re eager to find and share the answers.  You’ve run qualitative research studies that have uncovered insights that have changed the course of your Products - and you’ve helped your team feel confident when they’re on the right track.

 

You are passionate about generative research.  You know that we’re often answering the wrong question and that a little more digging often uncovers the question that we should be asking.  You’re comfortable telling the organization uncomfortable truths about what we’re doing - with clarity, compassion, and conviction.

Cross-functional peers across the organization come to you for advice on how to better understand the impact they’re delivering in marketing, sales, and support.  Your clear and inviting communication brings people along, and your empathy and connection let them see the world from the user’s perspective.

 

Your work demonstrates your strengths, and an innate curiosity to understand people’s needs and working styles. You build positive relationships with product managers, engineers, and front-line support. You value open and honest discussion and are always looking to learn. You wholeheartedly empathize with the human side of the patient experience and want to make healthcare delightful.

 

Requirements:

  • A body of work that clearly demonstrates insight, empathy, and an ability to tackle complex problems on behalf of users, showcasing the value you’ve delivered.
  • Excitement in helping teams define the problems they’re trying to solve, coupled with passion for getting them to the answers they need.
  • Minimum 6 years of experience in UX Research, with an emphasis on supporting the creation of useful, usable, and delightful products
  • Experience with developing, testing, and refining research based on best-practices, foundational methodologies, and emerging understanding of human behavior. Confident with a variety of prototyping and user research methodologies.
  • Deep comfort with current research methodologies, accessible web design standards, and the current state-of-the-art for consumer design experiences
  • Compelling communication capabilities. You understand that sharing the insights is the most impactful part of what you do.  

Bonus points:

  • Experience with Design Sprints.  Double bonus points for facilitation exposure.
  • Setting up user research programs in a B2B2C world
  • Partnering with Sales and Marketing to refine our messaging so it reflects the power of our brand and our tools
  • Real passion for the Grand Rounds product suite; belief that our services can transform how we access and utilize healthcare

 

Grand Rounds is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law. Grand Rounds considers all qualified applicants in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
listing.title: Lead UX Researcher

company.tagline: We are reimagining and transforming how people experience health care
company.name: Grand Rounds

listing.description:
About Us

Grand Rounds' vision is to create a path to great health and health care, for everyone, everywhere. Founded in 2011, the company provides an employer-based technology solution that connects members and their families to high-quality care. With Grand Rounds, employers get a personalized, high-performance network at scale, while their employees get the tools and support needed to navigate their care on their own terms. Named Rock Health’s 2018 Fastest Growing Company, Grand Rounds helps restore individual health and quality of life, and offers employers lower health care spend and higher employee productivity. For more information, please visit  www.grandrounds.com.

Our purpose
Healthcare is confusing. It’s hard to access, to understand, and to ensure you’re getting the right care that leads to the right outcomes. Grand Rounds exists to make a difference in all of it. Our vision is to craft a path to great health and health care, for everyone, everywhere. We work alongside company’s insurance plans, helping to guide people to the best care for them.

Our team
We’re a tight, collaborative team of product designers, marketing designers, and user experience researchers, working in close partnership with our product management and engineering teams. We are passionate advocates for all our users - from our award-winning Care Team, to our doctors and clinicians, to the members that use our products every day. We realize that we have the opportunity to transform a confusing and archaic system and we relish the challenge of making life better for the people that need us the most.

You!
We’re looking for a Lead Visual Designer to craft a better future with us. Somebody who can envision and deliver delightful, insightful, and engaging experiences which will guide our Members to achieve better health outcomes. You’ll help us transform how people access, understand, and interact with their care.

You’re excited to own an entire design system and styleguide end-to-end. You have crafted and delivered insightful experiences that brought clarity to complex situations. You think systemically and see how all the pieces visually fit together. You love educating people on the merits of gradients versus textures. You possess a deep and abiding fondness for fonts and look for ways to bring together styles in engaging and unusual combinations.

Cross-functional peers across the organization come to you for advice on how to better understand the impact they’re delivering in marketing, sales, and product. Your clear and inviting communication brings people along, and your empathy and connection help them effectively reach their users.

Your work demonstrates your strengths, and an innate curiosity to understand people’s needs and working styles. You build positive relationships with product managers, engineers, and front-line support. You value open and honest discussion and are always looking to learn. You wholeheartedly empathize with the human side of the patient experience and want to make healthcare delightful.

Requirements:

  •  A body of work that clearly demonstrates insight, empathy, and an ability to tackle complex problems on behalf of users.

  •  Passionate advocacy for high-quality design, execution, and implementation of interactive web sites and mobile apps.

  •  Ownership in building and shipping design systems. Deep expertise about typography, layout, and color exploration. And a willingness to make the whole team smarter about their uses.

  •  Minimum 8 years of experience in design, with an emphasis on shipping useful, usable, and delightful products.

  •  Experience developing, testing, and refining concepts based on research, insights, and brand vision.

  •  Mastery of current design tools, responsive web design standards, and the current state-of-the-art for consumer-facing experiences.

  •  Compelling communication capabilities. You understand that sharing the insights is the most impactful part of what you do. 

 

Bonus Points:

  •  Partnership with engineering to build and extend UI frameworks that translate design concepts into fully realized code elements.

  •  Collaboration with Sales and Marketing to refine messaging so it reflects the power of the brand and the tools.

  •  Experience with Design Sprints.

  •  Real passion for the Grand Rounds product suite; belief that ourservices can transform how we access and utilize healthcare. 

  •  
Grand Rounds is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law. Grand Rounds considers all qualified applicants in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
listing.title: Lead UI/Visual Designer

company.tagline: We are reimagining and transforming how people experience health care
company.name: Grand Rounds

listing.description:
Markit Digital is dedicated to the delivery and presentation of financial data, transforming complex information into elegant user experiences. As a leading Software as a Service (SaaS) provider in the financial services industry, our innovative visualizations are the standard for interpreting, manipulating and displaying financial information.

 

The design team at Markit Digital is one of the largest in the financial industry. Our work, and how we work affects the way our clients do business, how their users make important decisions and what finance means to the world. As individuals, we come from many backgrounds and perspectives. While some of us have finance experience, our larger belief is that new ideas come from learning, research, analytical thinking, questioning and translating what we know to new contexts. In our data-driven world, making the complex simple is a prime challenge. This is the core of what we do.

 

Have you ever thought about the typical user experience involved with trading on the stock market? Does the poor design of your banking app often leave you scratching your head? What if you could make it better? We’re in the business of making the financial world friendlier and we’re looking for energetic designers who can geek out about data and ways to present it to regular humans. You’ll be exposed to a plethora of unique projects and challenges from clients located both domestically and around the world—Australia, Singapore, Italy and the UK, to name a few—and the solutions are never cookie-cutter.

 

As a Designer you have:

  • One or more years design experience; focusing on interface and data display for web, mobile and desktop applications
  • Mastery of your tools—Adobe Creative Cloud and interactive prototyping tools. Familiarity with HTML, CSS and Java Script would also be helpful
  • An analytical and visual mind, with a hunger for learning and a desire to solve complex human problems with technology
  • Strong process—concept and refine designs through sketches, diagrams, wireframes, visual designs and interactive pieces
  • A desire to challenge yourself both personally and professionally; as well as staying current with technology and interaction design trends.
listing.title: UX/Information Designer

company.tagline: We provide industry-leading data, software and technology platforms.
company.name: IHS Markit Digital

listing.description:
Linked by Air is an award-winning and growing design and technology firm. We integrate strategy, user experience, interaction and visual design, and software development to create design systems and build digital products that grow with their institutions, put users first, and break new ground. Many of our clients are in the cultural sector.

We are looking for a full-stack web developer to join our team. The position is full-time and on-site at our office in NYC. You will be working closely with a dynamic, multi-disciplinary, and talented team who are also pretty nice people. And you will be working with a range of interesting clients on projects that combine new and bespoke challenges with expansion and development of a platform that extends across our work.

Responsibilities:

-Write well designed, testable, and efficient code.

-Build front-end layouts and user interfaces.

-Integrate data from various back-end services and databases.

-Debug and troubleshoot existing code.

-Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs.

-Assist with the maintenance and upgrading of our custom Ruby on Rails CMS.

-Work independently to provide technical support and bug fixes when requested by existing clients through an issue tracking system.

-Train clients in how to use their CMS.

-Collaborate with designers and other team members.

-Participate in teaching and learning/knowledge transfer among colleagues. Be interested in learning and mastering new technologies and techniques.

-Stay up to date on emerging technologies and industry trends.

Requirements:

-Comfortable writing HTML, JavaScript, and SASS and doing cross-browser testing.

-Strong attention to detail, to build front-ends that closely match design specs.

-Experience in one or more scripting languages, preferably Ruby.

-An understanding of MVC frameworks, preferably Rails.

-Familiarity with version control systems and workflows.

-2-4 years professional experience preferable.

-An interest in art and design.
listing.title: Developer

company.tagline: Linked by Air is a design and technology firm.
company.name: Linked by Air

listing.description:
Additional Job Description

Its an exciting time to join our team at The New York Times. Since launching NYT Cookings digital subscription business in mid-2017, we are focused on growing our audience and continuing to help millions of people decide what to cook. We are seeking a Product Designer to work closely with the teams Design Lead to execute the vision, user experience, and visual design of the new features were building for both web and iOS platforms.

 

We are a small, cross-functional team. You will collaborate with Product, Technology, and Editorial partners to arrive at engaging, delightful solutions that help users understand the value of our product and differentiate NYT Cooking in the digital cooking space.

 

You will work to uncover, define, and address unmet user and business needs; raise creative ways we can motivate users to continuously invest in our product; and push our design process toward a more iterative, agile way of working. Your work will not only enrich peoples lives by making them better, more confident cooks, but also champion the notion that high-quality recipes and instruction are worth paying for.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Support high-level product strategy, ensuring were asking the right questions and solving for distinct needs.
  • Create documentation (e.g. user journeys, experience maps) for use by the team to build consensus and facilitate conversations.
  • Take product ideas and hone them into multiple solutions and concrete approaches, then collaboratively narrow ideas and define requirements.
  • Design production-ready deliverables.
  • Collaborate with engineers to assure the visual quality of our output. Use browser developer tools to fine-tune user interface elements.
  • Continuously think about how to build habits into our experience and drive subscription growth.

 

 

Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 4 years experience designing web / mobile consumer websites or products.
  • A portfolio demonstrating best practices in cross-platform interaction design and design decisions based on usage patterns, user feedback, business needs, and an evolving competitive landscape.
  • Exceptional visual and typographic sensibility, paired with an eye toward effective interfaces and extensible design systems.
  • Experience working on cross-functional teams, collaborating closely with product managers and engineers.
  • Experience designing editorial content and partnering with content producers.
  • A shown understanding of modern HTML & CSS, and grasp of current development philosophies / methodologies for building consumer products.

 

 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Comfortable working with remote teammates.
  • Excellent listening skills. Gives and receives honest, thoughtful feedback.
  • Adopts a growth mindset when approaching work, believing that their output can always be improved upon. Applies what he/she has learned from one project to the next.
  • Can work at a range of fidelity levels, from simple sketch to pixel-perfection, and understands what level of detail an artifact should require for a given task or goal.
  • Experience directing the creation of assets (photography, video, illustration, etc.).
  • An interest in food / cooking and enthusiasm for The New York Times mission.

 

This position is based in New York, NY.

 

Applications without portfolios will not be considered. When you apply, please share samples of your work, focusing on projects that showcase:

  • Your process for problem-solving (rather than just polished, final design work).
  • How you identify and address a distinct user need, and iterate based on what you learn.
  • Varying types of design artifacts, and your sensibility of which design exercises meet a particular purpose.

 

Benefits and Perks:

  • Make an impact by supporting our original, independent and deeply reported journalism.
  • We provide competitive health, dental, vision and life insurance for employees and their families
  • We support responsible retirement planning with a generous 401(k) company match.
  • We offer a competitive parental leave.
  • We are committed to career development and ongoing learning, and provide employees $8,000 annually for tuition reimbursement.
  • We have frequent panel discussions and talks by a wide variety of newsmakers and industry leaders.
  • Join a community committed to the richness of diversity, experiences and talents in the world we cover, supported by a variety of employee resource groups.
listing.title: Product Designer, NYT Cooking

listing.description:
GPS Impact is seeking a talented Graphic Designer for a full-time position in our Kansas City office. The skilled applicant will work directly with the Creative Director and development team on a variety of projects. Applicants must have a stellar portfolio, experience with the fundamentals of website design, strong communication skills, an eagerness to learn and improve with a determined work ethic.

Responsibilities –

  • The role of this creative is to design beautiful web art mockups: Desktop and Mobile Sites, Wireframing, Online Advertisements, Social Graphics and Print Pieces.
  • Occasionally code HTML and CSS (including latest HTML5 & CSS3 features).
  • Present your work mockups for internal critique and client review.
  • Work creatively and quickly meeting quality and accuracy standards.
  • Must be able to work in a professional, fast-paced and team environment.
  • Collaborate with fellow colleagues on various project types.
  • Capable of multitasking, prioritizing, managing time efficiently and meeting deadlines.
  • Collaborate with Creative Team on all projects.

Experience & Qualifications –

  • Minimum of 1-2 years of web and print design and production experience.
  • Associate or Bachelor’s degree preferred in graphic design or related field.
  • Demonstrate expert level skills in the latest Adobe Creative Suite.
  • Strong time management and organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects.
  • Possess strong written and verbal communication skills and be a self-starter who takes pride in their work.
  • Be highly creative and innovative with excellent attention to details.
  • Skills in creating modern designs for print, web and production.
  • Strong understanding of modern web design principles, user experience, information architecture, and social media.
  • Knowledge in creating and producing advertising for print, web and email.

Bonus –

Strong passion for politics and progressive movements

Familiarity with coding CSS and HTML

Experience with UX design, WordPress and working with developers

 

Why GPS?

We work with meaningful causes, movements, campaigns, and organizations, for example:

The Pennsylvania Democratic Party, NARAL, Priorities USA, The Fairness Project, ACLU, Women’s Foundation, DCCC, and Governors, Senators and Congress people from coast to coast.

  • Potential for growth in the role and within the company
  • A highly-creative, award-winning team that strives to innovate
  • Competitive compensation and benefits, including:
    • Competitive salaries
    • Healthcare benefits
    • Potential to participate in the company 401k
    • Professional development opportunities

How to Apply – To apply for this position, email with the subject line: “Graphic Designer Position” with your application materials:

  1. Your resume
  2. A link to your portfolio or work samples
  3. A short description of why you want to be a Graphic Designer at GPS Impact
  4. An example of an artist/designer or piece of work that inspires you

GPS Impact is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants of diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply.
